description: From earlier tag-rag and tag and rag, from rag + tag.

adjectives.description: ragtag (comparative more ragtag, superlative most ragtag)

entries.meaning: Unkempt, shabby, or in a state of disrepair.
examples: He liked to wear an old ragtag coat that was so threadbare that he'd get sunburned through it.

entries.meaning: Very diverse; having irregular and dissimilar components.
examples: The guerrillas were a ragtag band of local thugs, former soldiers, displaced farmers, and political idealists.
The small group of ragtags, who had followed him to the cave a day prior had arrived and kept a short distance away.
